summary: This is an email from a Deputy Assistant Inspector General at the DOJ Office of the Inspector General, dated September 16, 2021, regarding an internal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. The sender requests adding a doctor (DR. [redacted]) to a list of interviews, as they could not locate a prior interview of this individual. The email references the doctor's involvement in assessing Epstein's suicide risk and housing recommendations while he was in custody.

persons.name: Dr. [Redacted]
persons.context: A doctor who consulted about Jeffrey Epstein's risk factors and ordered him placed on watch status for a suicide risk assessment after he returned from court. The doctor also got involved in Epstein's housing recommendations.

persons.name: Dr. S
persons.context: A National Suicide Prevention Coordinator from the Central Office with whom Dr. [Redacted] had a conversation regarding Epstein's housing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose psychological health, risk factors, and housing were being assessed by medical staff while in custody.

persons.name: Deputy Assistant Inspector General
persons.context: The sender of the email from the Office of the Inspector General, Department of Justice, requesting an individual be added to an interview list for an investigation.

connections.description: Dr. [Redacted] consulted on Epstein's risk factors and ordered him placed on watch status for a suicide risk assessment.
Dr. [Redacted] had a conversation with Dr. S, the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator, regarding Epstein's housing.
The Deputy Assistant Inspector General is seeking to interview Dr. [Redacted] as part of an investigation.

events.title: Email Request for Interview Addition
events.description: A Deputy Assistant Inspector General sends an email requesting that Dr. [Redacted] be added to a list of interviews for an investigation, as a prior interview could not be located.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: After returning from court, Dr. [Redacted] ordered Jeffrey Epstein be placed on watch status to allow psychology to complete a thorough suicide risk assessment.

events.title: Epstein's Housing Recommendation
events.description: Following a conversation with Dr. S, Dr. [Redacted] got involved in Epstein's housing and recommended he be housed with a sex offender in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

keyFacts: A doctor (DR. [redacted]) was involved in assessing Jeffrey Epstein's suicide risk and housing while he was in custody, but a prior interview of this doctor could not be located by investigators.
Dr. [Redacted] ordered Epstein be placed on watch status for a suicide risk assessment after he returned from court.
Dr. [Redacted], after consulting with the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator (Dr. S), recommended housing Epstein with a sex offender in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
The email is part of an Office of the Inspector General investigation, indicating an ongoing internal review of events surrounding Epstein's death.
The document references attached reports and emails (References #1 and #6) that contain further details about the risk assessment and housing recommendations.
